com.teamdev.jxbrowser.chromium

Interface WebStorage


  • public interface WebStorage
    The WebStorage interface of the Web Storage API provides access to the session storage or local storage for a particular document on the loaded web page, allowing you to for example add, modify or delete stored data items.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean clear()
      Removes all key/value pairs in the storage.
      boolean contains(java.lang.String key)
      Returns true if storage contains specified key or false otherwise.
      java.lang.String getItem(java.lang.String key)
      Returns the value associated with the given key or null when the key doesn't exist.
      java.lang.String key(long index)
      Returns the name of the key in the storage.
      long length()
      Returns number of key/value pairs in the storage.
      boolean removeItem(java.lang.String key)
      Removes key/value pair from the storage.
      boolean setItem(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Adds the key and value to the storage, or updates key's value if it already exists.

    • Method Detail

      • length

        long length()
        Returns number of key/value pairs in the storage.
        Returns:
        number of key/value pairs in the storage. Returns 0 if the storage hasn't been initialized yet or has no key/value pairs.

      • key

        java.lang.String key(long index)
        Returns the name of the key in the storage. The order of keys is user-agent defined, so you should not rely on it.
        Parameters:
        index - an integer representing the number of the key you want to get the name of. This is a zero-based index. Must be in range 0 < index < length().
        Returns:
        a string containing the name of the key or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the index isn't in 0 < index < length() range.

      • getItem

        java.lang.String getItem(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the value associated with the given key or null when the key doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the key you want to retrieve the value of. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the value associated with the given key or null when the key doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the key is null.

      • setItem

        boolean setItem(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.String value)
        Adds the key and value to the storage, or updates key's value if it already exists.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the key you want to create/update. Cannot be null.
        value - the value you want to give the key you are creating/updating. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if key/value pair was successfully added or updated. Returns false in case of exceptions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the key or value is null.

      • removeItem

        boolean removeItem(java.lang.String key)
        Removes key/value pair from the storage.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the key you want to remove. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if key/value pair was successfully removed, or key doesn't exist. Returns false in case of exceptions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the key is null.

      • clear

        boolean clear()
        Removes all key/value pairs in the storage.
        Returns:
        true if storage was successfully cleared. Returns false in case of exceptions or storage was not initialized.

      • contains

        boolean contains(java.lang.String key)
        Returns true if storage contains specified key or false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the key you want to check. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if storage contains specified key or false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the key is null.
